db:abstract.db:para: The QChar class provides a 16-bit Unicode character.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: In Qt, Unicode characters are 16-bit entities without any markup or structure. This class represents such an entity. It is lightweight, so it can be used everywhere. Most compilers treat it like a unsigned short.

QChar provides a full complement of testing/classification functions, converting to and from other formats, converting from composed to decomposed Unicode, and trying to compare and case-convert if you ask it to.

The classification functions include functions like those in the standard C++ header <cctype> (formerly <ctype.h>), but operating on the full range of Unicode characters, not just for the ASCII range. They all return true if the character is a certain type of character; otherwise they return false. These classification functions are isNull() (returns true if the character is '\0'), isPrint() (true if the character is any sort of printable character, including whitespace), isPunct() (any sort of punctation), isMark() (Unicode Mark), isLetter() (a letter), isNumber() (any sort of numeric character, not just 0-9), isLetterOrNumber(), and isDigit() (decimal digits). All of these are wrappers around category() which return the Unicode-defined category of each character. Some of these also calculate the derived properties (for example isSpace() returns true if the character is of category Separator_* or an exceptional code point from Other_Control category).

QChar also provides direction(), which indicates the "natural" writing direction of this character. The joiningType() function indicates how the character joins with it's neighbors (needed mostly for Arabic or Syriac) and finally hasMirrored(), which indicates whether the character needs to be mirrored when it is printed in it's "unnatural" writing direction.
Composed Unicode characters (like ring) can be converted to decomposed Unicode ("a" followed by "ring above") by using decomposition().

In Unicode, comparison is not necessarily possible and case conversion is very difficult at best. Unicode, covering the "entire" world, also includes most of the world's case and sorting problems. operator==() and friends will do comparison based purely on the numeric Unicode value (code point) of the characters, and toUpper() and toLower() will do case changes when the character has a well-defined uppercase/lowercase equivalent. For locale-dependent comparisons, use QString::localeAwareCompare().

The conversion functions include unicode() (to a scalar), toLatin1() (to scalar, but converts all non-Latin-1 characters to 0), row() (gives the Unicode row), cell() (gives the Unicode cell), digitValue() (gives the integer value of any of the numerous digit characters), and a host of constructors.

QChar provides constructors and cast operators that make it easy to convert to and from traditional 8-bit chars. If you defined QT_NO_CAST_FROM_ASCII and QT_NO_CAST_TO_ASCII, as explained in the QString documentation, you will need to explicitly call fromLatin1(), or use QLatin1Char, to construct a QChar from an 8-bit char, and you will need to call toLatin1() to get the 8-bit value back.
For more information see "About the Unicode Character Database".

db:section.db:title: enum QChar::Category
db:section.db:para: This enum maps the Unicode character categories.
The following characters are normative in Unicode:
The following categories are informative in Unicode:

db:section.db:title: enum QChar::Decomposition
db:section.db:para: This enum type defines the Unicode decomposition attributes. See the Unicode Standard for a description of the values.

db:section.db:title: enum QChar::Direction
db:section.db:para: This enum type defines the Unicode direction attributes. See the Unicode Standard for a description of the values.
In order to conform to C/C++ naming conventions "Dir" is prepended to the codes used in the Unicode Standard.

db:section.db:title: enum QChar::JoiningType
db:section.db:para: since 5.3
This enum type defines the Unicode joining type attributes. See the Unicode Standard for a description of the values.
In order to conform to C/C++ naming conventions "Joining_" is prepended to the codes used in the Unicode Standard.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.1] enum QChar::Script
db:section.db:para: This enum type defines the Unicode script property values.
For details about the Unicode script property values see Unicode Standard Annex #24.
In order to conform to C/C++ naming conventions "Script_" is prepended to the codes used in the Unicode Standard.

db:td.db:para: For unassigned, private-use, noncharacter, and surrogate code points.

For characters that may be used with multiple scripts and that inherit their script from the preceding characters. These include nonspacing marks, enclosing marks, and zero width joiner/non-joiner characters.
For characters that may be used with multiple scripts and that do not inherit their script from the preceding characters.

db:section.db:para: This enum was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:td.db:para: A QChar with this value isNull().
The character shown when a font has no glyph for a certain codepoint. A special question mark character is often used. Codecs use this codepoint when input data cannot be represented in Unicode.
Used to represent an object such as an image when such objects cannot be presented.

db:section.db:title: enum QChar::UnicodeVersion
db:section.db:para: Specifies which version of the Unicode standard introduced a certain character.

db:td.db:para: The value is not assigned to any character in version 8.0 of Unicode.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null QChar ('\0').

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar(QChar::SpecialCharacter ch)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar for the predefined character value ch.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar(QLatin1Char ch)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar corresponding to ASCII/Latin-1 character ch.

db:section.db:title: [explicit noexcept] QChar::QChar(char ch)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar corresponding to ASCII/Latin-1 character ch.

db:note.db:para: This constructor is not available when QT_NO_CAST_FROM_ASCII is defined.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar(int code)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar for the character with Unicode code point code.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar(short code)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar for the character with Unicode code point code.

db:section.db:title: [explicit noexcept] QChar::QChar(uchar ch)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar corresponding to ASCII/Latin-1 character ch.

db:note.db:para: This constructor is not available when QT_NO_CAST_FROM_ASCII is defined.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar(uint code)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar for the character with Unicode code point code.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar(ushort code)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar for the character with Unicode code point code.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::QChar(uchar cell, uchar row)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QChar for Unicode cell cell in row row.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::Category QChar::category() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the character's category.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QChar::Category QChar::category(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the category of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] uchar QChar::cell() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the cell (least significant byte) of the Unicode character.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] unsigned char QChar::combiningClass() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the combining class for the character as defined in the Unicode standard. This is mainly useful as a positioning hint for marks attached to a base character.
The Qt text rendering engine uses this information to correctly position non-spacing marks around a base character.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] unsigned char QChar::combiningClass(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the combining class for the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4, as defined in the Unicode standard.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QChar::UnicodeVersion QChar::currentUnicodeVersion()
db:section.db:para: Returns the most recent supported Unicode version.

db:section.db:title: QString QChar::decomposition() const
db:section.db:para: Decomposes a character into it's constituent parts. Returns an empty string if no decomposition exists.

db:section.db:title: [static] QString QChar::decomposition(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Decomposes the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 into it's constituent parts. Returns an empty string if no decomposition exists.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::Decomposition QChar::decompositionTag() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the tag defining the composition of the character. Returns QChar::NoDecomposition if no decomposition exists.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QChar::Decomposition QChar::decompositionTag(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the tag defining the composition of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4. Returns QChar::NoDecomposition if no decomposition exists.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QChar::digitValue() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the numeric value of the digit, or -1 if the character is not a digit.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] int QChar::digitValue(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the numeric value of the digit specified by the UCS-4-encoded character, ucs4, or -1 if the character is not a digit.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::Direction QChar::direction() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the character's direction.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QChar::Direction QChar::direction(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the direction of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QChar QChar::fromLatin1(char c)
db:section.db:para: Converts the Latin-1 character c to its equivalent QChar. This is mainly useful for non-internationalized software.
An alternative is to use QLatin1Char.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::hasMirrored() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character should be reversed if the text direction is reversed; otherwise returns false.
A bit faster equivalent of (ch.mirroredChar() != ch).

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::hasMirrored(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 should be reversed if the text direction is reversed; otherwise returns false.
A bit faster equivalent of (QChar::mirroredChar(ucs4) != ucs4).
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] ushort QChar::highSurrogate(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: Returns the high surrogate part of a UCS-4-encoded code point. The returned result is undefined if ucs4 is smaller than 0x10000.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isDigit() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a decimal digit (Number_DecimalDigit); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isDigit(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a decimal digit (Number_DecimalDigit); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isHighSurrogate() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the QChar is the high part of a UTF16 surrogate (for example if its code point is in range [0xd800..0xdbff]); false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] bool QChar::isHighSurrogate(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is the high part of a UTF16 surrogate (for example if its code point is in range [0xd800..0xdbff]); false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isLetter() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a letter (Letter_* categories); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isLetter(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a letter (Letter_* categories); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isLetterOrNumber() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a letter or number (Letter_* or Number_* categories); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isLetterOrNumber(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a letter or number (Letter_* or Number_* categories); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isLowSurrogate() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the QChar is the low part of a UTF16 surrogate (for example if its code point is in range [0xdc00..0xdfff]); false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] bool QChar::isLowSurrogate(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is the low part of a UTF16 surrogate (for example if its code point is in range [0xdc00..0xdfff]); false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isLower() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a lowercase letter, for example category() is Letter_Lowercase.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isLower(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a lowercase letter, for example category() is Letter_Lowercase.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isMark() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a mark (Mark_* categories); otherwise returns false.
See QChar::Category for more information regarding marks.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isMark(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a mark (Mark_* categories); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isNonCharacter() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the QChar is a non-character; false otherwise.

Unicode has a certain number of code points that are classified as "non-characters:" that is, they can be used for internal purposes in applications but cannot be used for text interchange. Those are the last two entries each Unicode Plane ([0xfffe..0xffff], [0x1fffe..0x1ffff], etc.) as well as the entries in range [0xfdd0..0xfdef].
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isNonCharacter(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a non-character; false otherwise.

Unicode has a certain number of code points that are classified as "non-characters:" that is, they can be used for internal purposes in applications but cannot be used for text interchange. Those are the last two entries each Unicode Plane ([0xfffe..0xffff], [0x1fffe..0x1ffff], etc.) as well as the entries in range [0xfdd0..0xfdef].
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is the Unicode character 0x0000 ('\0'); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isNumber() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a number (Number_* categories, not just 0-9); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isNumber(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a number (Number_* categories, not just 0-9); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isPrint() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a printable character; otherwise returns false. This is any character not of category Other_*.
Note that this gives no indication of whether the character is available in a particular font.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isPrint(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a printable character; otherwise returns false. This is any character not of category Other_*.
Note that this gives no indication of whether the character is available in a particular font.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isPunct() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a punctuation mark (Punctuation_* categories); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isPunct(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a punctuation mark (Punctuation_* categories); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isSpace() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a separator character (Separator_* categories or certain code points from Other_Control category); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isSpace(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a separator character (Separator_* categories or certain code points from Other_Control category); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isSurrogate() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the QChar contains a code point that is in either the high or the low part of the UTF-16 surrogate range (for example if its code point is in range [0xd800..0xdfff]); false otherwise.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isSurrogate(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 contains a code point that is in either the high or the low part of the UTF-16 surrogate range (for example if its code point is in range [0xd800..0xdfff]); false otherwise.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isSymbol() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a symbol (Symbol_* categories); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isSymbol(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a symbol (Symbol_* categories); otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isTitleCase() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is a titlecase letter, for example category() is Letter_Titlecase.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isTitleCase(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a titlecase letter, for example category() is Letter_Titlecase.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QChar::isUpper() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the character is an uppercase letter, for example category() is Letter_Uppercase.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.0] bool QChar::isUpper(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is an uppercase letter, for example category() is Letter_Uppercase.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 5.3] QChar::JoiningType QChar::joiningType() const
db:section.db:para: Returns information about the joining type attributes of the character (needed for certain languages such as Arabic or Syriac).
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.3] QChar::JoiningType QChar::joiningType(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns information about the joining type attributes of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 (needed for certain languages such as Arabic or Syriac).
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] ushort QChar::lowSurrogate(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: Returns the low surrogate part of a UCS-4-encoded code point. The returned result is undefined if ucs4 is smaller than 0x10000.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar QChar::mirroredChar() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the mirrored character if this character is a mirrored character; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] uint QChar::mirroredChar(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the mirrored character if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 is a mirrored character; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] bool QChar::requiresSurrogates(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 can be split into the high and low parts of a UTF16 surrogate (for example if its code point is greater than or equals to 0x10000); false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] uchar QChar::row() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the row (most significant byte) of the Unicode character.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 5.1] QChar::Script QChar::script() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the Unicode script property value for this character.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 5.1] QChar::Script QChar::script(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the Unicode script property value for the character specified in its UCS-4-encoded form as ucs4.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] uint QChar::surrogateToUcs4(ushort high, ushort low)
db:section.db:para: Converts a UTF16 surrogate pair with the given high and low values to it's UCS-4-encoded code point.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] uint QChar::surrogateToUcs4(QChar high, QChar low)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Converts a UTF16 surrogate pair (high, low) to it's UCS-4-encoded code point.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar QChar::toCaseFolded() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the case folded equivalent of the character. For most Unicode characters this is the same as toLower().

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] uint QChar::toCaseFolded(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the case folded equivalent of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4. For most Unicode characters this is the same as toLower().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] char QChar::toLatin1() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the Latin-1 character equivalent to the QChar, or 0. This is mainly useful for non-internationalized software.

db:note.db:para: It is not possible to distinguish a non-Latin-1 character from a Latin-1 0 (NUL) character. Prefer to use unicode(), which does not have this ambiguity.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar QChar::toLower() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the lowercase equivalent if the character is uppercase or titlecase; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] uint QChar::toLower(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the lowercase equivalent of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 if the character is uppercase or titlecase; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar QChar::toTitleCase() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the title case equivalent if the character is lowercase or uppercase; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] uint QChar::toTitleCase(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the title case equivalent of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 if the character is lowercase or uppercase; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar QChar::toUpper() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the uppercase equivalent if the character is lowercase or titlecase; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] uint QChar::toUpper(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the uppercase equivalent of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 if the character is lowercase or titlecase; otherwise returns the character itself.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] ushort &QChar::unicode()
db:section.db:para: Returns a reference to the numeric Unicode value of the QChar.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] ushort QChar::unicode() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the numeric Unicode value of the QChar.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QChar::UnicodeVersion QChar::unicodeVersion() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the Unicode version that introduced this character.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] QChar::UnicodeVersion QChar::unicodeVersion(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the Unicode version that introduced the character specified in its UCS-4-encoded form as ucs4.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator!=(QChar c1, QChar c2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if c1 and c2 are not the same Unicode character; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator<(QChar c1, QChar c2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the numeric Unicode value of c1 is less than that of c2; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &out, QChar chr)
db:section.db:para: Writes the char chr to the stream out.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator<=(QChar c1, QChar c2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the numeric Unicode value of c1 is less than or equal to that of c2; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator==(QChar c1, QChar c2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if c1 and c2 are the same Unicode character; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator>(QChar c1, QChar c2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the numeric Unicode value of c1 is greater than that of c2; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator>=(QChar c1, QChar c2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the numeric Unicode value of c1 is greater than or equal to that of c2; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &in, QChar &chr)
db:section.db:para: Reads a char from the stream in into char chr.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QChar
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QChar are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] enum QChar::Joining
db:section.db:para: This enum is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
in 5.3, use JoiningType instead.
This enum type defines the Unicode joining attributes. See the Unicode Standard for a description of the values.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, deprecated] QChar::Joining QChar::joining() const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
in 5.3, use joiningType() instead.
Returns information about the joining properties of the character (needed for certain languages such as Arabic).

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, deprecated] QChar::Joining QChar::joining(uint ucs4)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This is an overloaded function.
in 5.3, use joiningType() instead.
Returns information about the joining properties of the UCS-4-encoded character specified by ucs4 (needed for certain languages such as Arabic).
